title: I am looking for Neiman Marcus font
author: MadChef

comments.content:
If you're talking about [Neiman Marcus main woodmark](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060958/http:/www.businessreviewusa.com/money_matters/NeimanMarcus.jpg), I don't think it's a font, rather a custom lettering.  
 [Eyehawk@MF WhatTheFontForum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060958/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/case/28229) suggested to start with "... [Snapper Script A&S](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060958/http:/www.artandsignstudio.com/snapper.html), straightened it out, and scaled it up vertically, and it looked like it might work."

Snapper Script A&S slanted 20 degrees left & compressed 50%.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060958im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SnapperScriptSlant20LeftCompress50_3907.jpg)
  
Good idea but perhaps use another script.  
Don

The freehand Neiman Marcus trademark has been around for at least 70 years (see ad from _Vogue_ in 1944, when you could buy a chic outfit from Neiman Marcus and still get change back from a fifty). It has undergone many small modifications over the years, and somewhere along the line they dropped the hyphen.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060958im_/http:/typophile.com/files/neiman-marcus-1944_5740.jpg)

Does anyone know who did the lettering?  
Don
